creator: ncsuandrew12@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 32319
Simplified version of our JUnit execution file.

When running JUnit tests with "ant -f execute.xml", we occasionally see an extra line containing a '>' character added to the end of the results XML file. This issue appears sporadically on two separate CentOS machines running Ant 1.7.1. A script I wrote to repeatedly run our JUnit tests over the weekend ran 245 times, 21 of which had at least one of the 11 results files get this extra line.

I'll upgrade to the latest available Ant and see if the problem persists.

creator: ncsuandrew12@gmail.com
text: Updating to 1.9.4 seems to fix the problem. After limiting the test suites to only those that run in under a second (some of which got the extra line in previous runs), I've gone through 342 runs so far without a single extra '>'.
please close the issue if upgrading was all that is required.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
